main.title: Behind the Art
main.subheading: Select from any of the videos below to watch and listen to artist talks, learn about our collection, experience performances from around the world, and get a behind-the-scene look at African arts.

videos.title: Portrait Photography in Senegal
videos.description: Watch Omar Victor Diop re-create famous Hollywood portraits. This video is part of the series Afripedia.

videos.title: Afrofuturism in North Carolina: Meet the Artists
videos.description: Learn about what Afrofuturism is and meet local Afrofuturists.

videos.title: Connect to Collectors Reggie and Celeste Hodges (Durham, NC)
videos.description: Find out more about art collectors Reggie and Celeste Hodges and their life together.

videos.title: Women and Sowei Masks
videos.description: Find out about sowei masks and their relation to women.

videos.title: Acquiring a Sowei Mask
videos.description: Learn how Reggie and Celeste Hodges came by a sowei mask.

videos.title: “Reading” a Sowei Mask
videos.description: Discover how to “read” a sowei mask and its different characteristics.

videos.title: A South African Status Axe
videos.description: Listen to Elizabeth Perrill as she talks about the importance of the South African status axe.

videos.title: Anatsui at Work: The Nomadic Aesthetic— Freedom to Move (Palazzo Fortuny). Susan Vogel. Courtesy Icarus Films.
videos.description: Watch El Anatsui at work and how he creates movement in his art.

videos.title: Anatsui at Work: Materials—From the Environment. Susan Vogel. Courtesy Icarus Films.
videos.description: Learn about how El Anatsui discovers his materials for his works of art.

videos.title: Cultural Re-creation
videos.description: Writer Missla Libsekal explores cultural evolution while considering Western perceptions of Africa. This video is part of the series Afripedia.

videos.title: Performance Art in Ghana
videos.description: Learn about visual artist Serge Attukwei Clottey and how his art speaks to current environmental issues. This video is part of the series Afripedia.
